result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevis James Rothschadl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to report to probation no later than 11/2/22 at 9:00 AM. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevis James Rothschadl

records.addlTxt: w/ Agreement attached. Signed by DE and Atty. Nelson. kma
Filed by Atty A Nelson. Includes 22CF578, 22CM333. jaf

2:32 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Trevis James Rothschadl in court. Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Trevis James Rothschadl. INCLUDES 22CF578, 22CM333 and 22CM384. ADA Ballo recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in Cts 2,3,4 and 5 in 22CM578 and case 22CM384 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 2:54 PM. kma

Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages

- No contact with Elizabeth S.
- No abusive contact with Jackie B.
- Comply with mental health treatment plan
- No unsupervised contact with minors under age 18, except as authorized by Agent
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J. Rothschadl.                            .  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:24 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius for today, DF: Trevis James Rothschadl appeared. DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC given. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. Court orders bond. Bond on file to be refunded. Adjourned. kma  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
